results.title: Man in space
results.creator_credit: Ward Kimball and Walt Disney Pictures
results.brief_description: With an introduction by Walt Disney, this film depicts the development of rockets from the ancient Chinese weapons to modern missiles. Shows how humans may conquer outer space and establish a manned earth satellite. Presents the steps by which we will assault the space barrier and comments on the problems of “weightlessness” in outer space. Includes a clip from Georges Melies “Le Voyage a la lune”.

results.title: Man in flight
results.creator_credit: Hamilton Luske and Walt Disney Animation Studios
results.brief_description: A Walt Disney animated production tracing the development of aviation and the men responsible. From Leonardo da Vinci’s earliest ideas in flight, the film documents the early pioneers’ attempts at manned flight such as France’s Mont Brothers and the United States’ George Cayley and the Wright Brothers. Explains the rapid development of aviation up to the present jet age. Edited by Lloyd Richardson, sound by Robert O’Cook, music by Oliver Wallace.

results.title: Man hunt
results.creator_credit: Peter Robinson, Reed Executive Selection and Video Arts
results.brief_description: Outlines how to conduct effective staff selection interviews. John Cleese portrays the managers, Ethel the Unready, Ivan the Terrible and William the Silent who show the common mistakes of lack of preparation, failure to encourage the candidate to talk openly and relevantly and failing to introduce direct and probing questions. Norman Bowler demonstrates the correct interview techniques.

results.title: Man and the state: the trial of Socrates
results.creator_credit: Bernard Wilets and Bailey Film Productions
results.brief_description: The trial and death of Socrates is one of the significant moments and most dramatic events in the history of Western civilization. It poses questions that are still deeply troubling to our society - how far should a society go in suppressing someone it feels is dangerously disruptive? The film draws on many Greek philosophers and touches on many facets of Greek life.

results.title: Man and the state: Machiavelli on political power
results.creator_credit: Bernard Wilets and Bailey Film Productions
results.brief_description: An open-ended film which looks at the ideas of Niccolo Machiavelli, particularly as they are manifested in “The Prince”. These ideas are discussed in their relation to the reality of the world view that they reflect - does Machiavelli merely supply a superficial rationale to opportunists and dictators or does he present the world as it is in reality?
